ABSTRACT

e introduce a new algorithm for regularized reconstruction of mulpectral (MS) images from noisy linear measurements. Unlike
aditional approaches, the proposed algorithm regularizes the revery problem by using a prior specified only through a learned
noising function. More specifically, we propose a new accelerated
adient method (AGM) variant of regularization by denoising (RED)
r model-based MS image reconstruction. The key ingredient of
r approach is the three-dimensional (3D) deep neural net (DNN)
noiser that can fully leverage spationspectral correlations within
S images. Our results suggest the generalizability of our MS-RED
gorithm, where a single trained DNN can be used to solve several
fferent MS imaging problems.

To conclude

๏ We increasingly rely on implicit regularization using

nonlinear operators, such as deep neural nets
๏ PnP and RED are a theoretically sound algorithm that

can leverage denoising neural nets as priors
๏ For certain large-scale problems, it is beneficial to

consider scalable PnP-SGD, BC-RED, and On-RED
